acceptanceCriteria.criterion: Inline validation errors shown on blur or change - When I enter invalid data in any form field (application, interview, assessment, submission), validation errors appear inline below the field on blur or after the first submission attempt (NFR-2.3)

Required fields marked with asterisk or "Required" label - All required fields across application, interview, assessment, and submission forms display a visual indicator (asterisk *) next to the label

Validation errors are specific - Error messages are human-readable and field-specific: "Company name is required", "Email must be valid", "Due date cannot be in the past", "URL format is invalid" — not generic "Invalid input"

Submit button disabled when form invalid - Submit/Create/Save buttons are disabled (with aria-disabled="true" per established accessibility pattern) when the form contains validation errors, and re-enabled once errors are resolved
Successful submission shows confirmation message - All form submissions display a success toast via sonner (already established in story 6.5 centralized pattern)
Validation rules consistent between client and server - Zod schemas on the frontend match Go validator tags on the backend for all validated fields (required, min/max length, format, enum values)

Server returns 400 with field-specific error details - Backend validation failures return {error: "Validation failed", code: "VALIDATION_FAILED", details: {"field_name": "error message"}} and the frontend displays these field-specific errors inline

doc.section: Story 6.6: Form Validation / Data Models and Contracts / Form Validation Flow
doc.snippet: Authoritative spec for story 6.6: defines Zod schema example for applicationSchema, VALIDATION_ERROR details format, form validation workflow steps (define schema → integrate RHF → inline errors → required markers → disable submit → server validate → field-specific errors).

doc.title: Architecture Document
doc.section: Consistency Rules - Validation / Error Handling / Implementation Patterns
doc.snippet: Mandates dual validation: Client (React Hook Form + Zod for UX) and Server (Go struct tags + custom validators for security). Error response format: {error: string, code: string, details?: object}. Always validate on both client AND server.

doc.title: Frontend Architecture
doc.section: Technology Stack / State Management / API Client
doc.snippet: Confirms react-hook-form 7.54.2 + Zod 3.24.2 + @hookform/resolvers 4.1.2 as form validation stack. Axios interceptor injects Bearer token and handles centralized error toasts. Form state managed via useForm hook with zodResolver.

doc.title: Backend Architecture
doc.snippet: Go models use validate/binding struct tags for input validation via go-playground/validator/v10. Custom error types in pkg/errors/ with ConvertError() function. Handler → Repository → Database layered pattern.

doc.title: Accessibility Standards
doc.section: Form Accessibility / Error Messages / Required Fields / Buttons
doc.snippet: ARIA error patterns: aria-invalid={!!error}, aria-describedby for error association, role='alert' on error messages. Required fields: aria-required='true' + visual asterisk. Disabled buttons: both disabled and aria-disabled='true'. Focus first error field on submit.

doc.title: Story 6.5: Error Handling (done)
doc.section: Dev Notes / Completion Notes / Senior Developer Review
doc.snippet: Established centralized error toasts via axios interceptor — components should NOT add toast.error for API errors (interceptor handles). ~29 files had redundant toast.error removed. Error codes mapped in errors.ts. VALIDATION_FAILED maps to generic message; form components must handle field-specific display separately.

doc.title: Epics Document
doc.snippet: Original story definition: Form validation with Zod schemas, inline validation, required field markers, server-side field-specific validation errors.

file.reason: Application create form. Has inline Zod formSchema (lines 47-68) with zodResolver (line 102). GAPS: No asterisks on required labels, no aria-invalid/aria-describedby on most fields, no aria-disabled on submit, no server-side field error handling. Schema must be extracted to schemas/application.ts and field names aligned with backend (company → company_name, position → title).
URL import form. Currently validates URL with basic string check (url.startsWith('http') on line 49). Must add Zod URL validation before extraction.

Interview form modal. Has inline Zod formSchema (lines 50-60), zodResolver with mode:'onChange' (line 79), isValid submit disabling (line 252). Has ARIA error patterns on interview_type and scheduled_date. GAPS: No asterisk on required labels. Schema should be extracted to schemas/interview.ts.
Add interview round dialog. Has inline Zod addRoundSchema (lines 43-55), zodResolver with mode:'onChange' (line 68), isValid gating (line 240). GAPS: No asterisk markers on required labels.

Assessment form. Has inline Zod formSchema (lines 38-59), zodResolver with mode:'onChange' (line 76), isValid gating (line 243). GAPS: No asterisk markers, no 'due date cannot be past' validation, no server error handling.

Submission form. Has inline Zod schema with cross-field .refine() validations (lines 37-86), zodResolver with mode:'onChange' (line 106), isValid gating (line 307). GAPS: No asterisk markers; notes field error not displayed inline.

Interviewer form. Has inline Zod schemas (lines 28-35), zodResolver (line 54). GAPS: No mode:'onChange', submit uses HTML disabled only (line 224) without aria-disabled, no aria-invalid/aria-describedby patterns. Required marker only in placeholder text.
Question form. Has inline Zod schemas (lines 28-35), zodResolver (line 54). GAPS: Same as interviewer form — no mode:'onChange', submit uses HTML disabled only (line 231), no ARIA error patterns.

File upload component. Already validates file type and size via validateFile() from file-service.ts (line 75). Shows error inline (lines 307-311). GAPS: Uses toast.error in handleFile which duplicates interceptor — review per 6.5 pattern.
Assessment file upload. Validates with validateAssessmentFile() (10MB limit, allows ZIP). Shows error inline. Same toast duplication gap as file-upload.tsx.

Error handling utilities from story 6.5. CRITICAL GAPS: (1) ErrorResponse.details typed as string[] but AC-7 needs map/object {field: message}. (2) No isValidationError() function. (3) No getFieldErrors() function to extract field-keyed errors. (4) Error code is VALIDATION_FAILED (matching backend) but story mentions VALIDATION_ERROR — reconcile to VALIDATION_FAILED.

Axios interceptor from story 6.5. Line 85: shows toast.error(getErrorMessage(error)) for ALL non-401 errors including validation. CRITICAL GAP: Must suppress generic toast for VALIDATION_FAILED responses that include field details, letting the form component handle inline display instead.

Core error types. AppError.Details is []string (line 13) — needs new FieldErrors map[string]string field for AC-7. ErrorValidationFailed constant is 'VALIDATION_FAILED' (line 24). NewValidationError() creates single-message error (line 138).

Error conversion. ConvertError converts validator.ValidationErrors to single string via formatValidationErrors (line 29-31). formatValidationErrors joins all field errors into one comma-separated string (line 71). GAPS: Must produce map[string]string instead. Missing tag handlers: 'url' and 'oneof'.
API response serialization. ErrorDetail has Details []string (line 19). Must add FieldErrors map[string]string json:'field_errors,omitempty' to support AC-7 field-specific error response format.

Handler error helpers from story 6.5. HandleError converts errors via ConvertError and masks internal errors. logHandlerError provides structured slog logging. No field-specific validation error helper exists.

Application handler. QuickCreateApplicationReq has binding tags: company_name (required), title (required), job_type (omitempty,oneof), source_url (omitempty,url,max=2048), notes (max=10000). Create/Update return generic message on validation failure — must return field-specific details.

Interview handler. CreateInterviewRequest binding tags: application_id (required), interview_type (required,oneof=phone_screen technical behavioral panel onsite other), scheduled_date (required). Must return field-specific validation errors.

Assessment handler. CreateAssessmentRequest binding tags: application_id (required), assessment_type (required,oneof), title (required,max=255), due_date (required). CreateSubmissionRequest: submission_type (required,oneof=github file_upload notes). Must return field-specific validation errors.

constraints.constraint: Centralized error handling: Axios interceptor (frontend/src/lib/axios.ts) shows toast.error for ALL API errors. Components must NOT add their own toast.error for API failures. For VALIDATION_FAILED responses with field details, the interceptor should suppress the generic toast and let the form component handle inline display via setError().

ARIA accessibility patterns from story 6.4: Use aria-invalid="true" on fields with errors, aria-describedby pointing to error message element, role="alert" on error messages. Use aria-disabled="true" on disabled submit buttons (not just HTML disabled). Focus first error field on failed submit.
Required field marking: Use semantic asterisk pattern — Label text + span.text-destructive with "*". Also set aria-required="true" on the input element.
Backend error code is VALIDATION_FAILED (not VALIDATION_ERROR as story mentions). Frontend errors.ts already maps this code. Keep this naming consistent.
Dual validation mandate: Client-side Zod schemas for UX responsiveness, server-side Go validator tags for security. Rules must match between Zod schemas and Go binding tags for all shared fields.

Backend response format: {success: false, error: {error: string, code: string, details?: string[], field_errors?: {field: message}}}. The field_errors map is a NEW addition for AC-7; existing Details []string remains for backward compatibility.
Form validation mode: Use mode: 'onChange' or mode: 'onBlur' in useForm options (not default 'onSubmit') to show inline validation on blur/change per AC-1. Several forms already use mode: 'onChange'.
Success toasts already established in story 6.5. Preserve existing toast.success() calls in form submit handlers. Do NOT re-add toast.error in catch blocks.
Only write comments that explain WHY, not WHAT. Code should be self-documenting.

interface.name: Backend Validation Error Response
interface.signature: HTTP 400: {success: false, error: {error: 'Validation failed', code: 'VALIDATION_FAILED', details: ['Field1 is required', ...], field_errors: {field_name: 'error message', ...}}}

interface.name: Gin ShouldBindJSON validation
interface.signature: c.ShouldBindJSON(&req) returns validator.ValidationErrors when binding fails; convert via formatValidationFieldErrors() to map[string]string

interface.name: zodResolver integration
interface.signature: useForm<T>({ resolver: zodResolver(schema), mode: 'onChange' }) returns { register, handleSubmit, formState: { errors, isValid, isSubmitting }, setError }

interface.name: isValidationError (to create)
interface.signature: isValidationError(error: unknown): boolean — checks if AxiosError response has code === 'VALIDATION_FAILED' and field_errors object

interface.name: getFieldErrors (to create)
interface.signature: getFieldErrors(error: unknown): Record<string, string> | undefined — extracts field_errors map from VALIDATION_FAILED response

interface.name: form.setError server-side pattern
interface.signature: Object.entries(getFieldErrors(error)).forEach(([field, msg]) => form.setError(field as keyof T, { message: msg }))

interface.signature: struct { ApplicationID int64 `binding:'required'`; AssessmentType string `binding:'required,oneof=...'`; Title string `binding:'required,max=255'`; DueDate string `binding:'required'`; ... }

Current verification approach is manual testing + build verification (npm run build, go build ./...). All form changes must pass TypeScript compilation with no errors. ideas.idea: Manual: Submit each form (application, interview, assessment, submission, interviewer, question) with empty required fields → verify inline errors appear below each field on blur or after first submit attempt.
Manual: Open each form and verify all required field labels display asterisk (*) indicator with correct styling (text-destructive class).

Manual: Enter invalid data in specific fields — empty company name → "Company name is required"; invalid URL → "Invalid URL format"; past due date → "Due date cannot be in the past". Verify messages are field-specific, not generic.

Manual: Trigger validation errors on each form → verify submit/create/save button is disabled with aria-disabled="true". Fix one error → verify button re-enables. Check keyboard: Tab to disabled button should still be focusable but not activatable.
Manual: Successfully submit each form → verify sonner success toast appears. Verify no duplicate toasts (one success only).

Cross-reference: For each field validated by Zod, verify corresponding Go binding tag has matching rules. Example: applicationSchema.company_name z.string().min(1).max(255) must match QuickCreateApplicationReq.CompanyName binding:"required" + max(255).

Manual: Bypass client Zod validation (e.g., disable JS or send raw API request with invalid data that Zod would catch) → verify backend returns 400 with field_errors map → verify frontend form displays those field errors inline via setError().
